conversation.ja_sentence: もう次の木曜日だよ！

conversation.en_sentence: If we don't get them sent out, the IRS could fine us a lot of money.
conversation.ja_sentence: もしそれまでに発送しないとIRSから高額の罰金が課せられるんだよ。

conversation.en_sentence: Make sure that you have form W9 filled out for all contractors.
conversation.ja_sentence: 全派遣社員のW9フォームに記入するのを忘れないでね。

conversation.en_sentence: Go ahead and write how much we paid each contractor on top of form W9.
conversation.ja_sentence: それぞれの派遣社員にいくら支払ったのかW9の一番上に記載してね。

conversation.en_sentence: Then make sure you get them all to accounting before the end of the day.
conversation.ja_sentence: それから今日中にそれを会計に渡すのを忘れないでくれるかな。

conversation.en_sentence: No worries, Nate.
conversation.ja_sentence: 気にしないでいいよ、ネイト。

conversation.en_sentence: Please let me know once you finished.
conversation.ja_sentence: 終わったら教えてね。

conversation.en_sentence: Hey Gerald, do you have a minute?
conversation.ja_sentence: ねえジェラルド、ちょっといい？

conversation.en_sentence: A customer who called in early this morning kept screaming and yelling at me.
conversation.ja_sentence: 今朝早く電話してきたお客様がずっと叫んだり怒鳴ったりしてるのよ。

conversation.en_sentence: I tried my best to help him, and even resolved the issue but he was still so angry.
conversation.ja_sentence: すごく親身に対応して、問題自体はもう解決したんだけど、まだ怒ってるのよ。

conversation.en_sentence: He said "I want my money back, and I want it now"!
conversation.ja_sentence: 「今すぐ返金しろ」って言ってるわ。

conversation.en_sentence: Then he said "I'm sick and tired of all of your mistakes, and I'm telling everybody I know how bad you really are"!
conversation.ja_sentence: うちの手違いが多すぎてうんざりだから、どれだけうちの会社が酷いかみんなに言いふらすって。

conversation.en_sentence: Maybe I'm not a good fit for customer service.
conversation.ja_sentence: 私カスタマーサービスに向いてないかも。

conversation.en_sentence: How should I handle them?
conversation.ja_sentence: どう対応したらいいのかしら。

conversation.en_sentence: I see, so I should get them to share their story and empathize with them.
conversation.ja_sentence: なるほど、じゃあ話をしてもらって、共感してあげればいいわけね。

conversation.en_sentence: So, it's a good idea to take notes.
conversation.ja_sentence: そうか、じゃあメモをとったほうがいいのね。

conversation.en_sentence: That's brilliant Gerald!
conversation.ja_sentence: それは賢いわね、ジェラルド！

conversation.en_sentence: You're absolutely right.
conversation.ja_sentence: その通りね。

conversation.en_sentence: I am representing the company, and I need to accept responsibility.
conversation.ja_sentence: 私は会社の代表として、その責任を受け入れなきゃね。

conversation.en_sentence: What do you do though when people start cussing at you?
conversation.ja_sentence: でももし誰かが罵声を浴びせてきたらどうするの？

conversation.en_sentence: Does it work?
conversation.ja_sentence: それで効き目はある？

conversation.ja_speaker: シェーン ブラウン
conversation.en_sentence: Oh thank you, that was quick.
conversation.ja_sentence: おー、ありがとう、早かったですね。

conversation.ja_speaker: シェーン ブラウン
conversation.en_sentence: I also got those pictures the customer sent us.
conversation.ja_sentence: 消費者から送られてきた写真も届きました。

conversation.ja_speaker: シェーン ブラウン
conversation.en_sentence: We have a customer claiming there are peanuts in our product.
conversation.ja_sentence: 消費者がうちの商品にピーナッツが混入していると主張しているんです。

conversation.ja_speaker: シェーン ブラウン
conversation.en_sentence: So we need to compare the same exact product with those pictures.
conversation.ja_sentence: なので、同じ商品と写真を見比べなければいけないんです。

conversation.ja_speaker: シェーン ブラウン
conversation.en_sentence: Yes, by all means.
conversation.ja_sentence: はい、もちろんです。

conversation.ja_speaker: シェーン ブラウン
conversation.en_sentence: To be honest, they do.
conversation.ja_sentence: 正直なところ、見えますよね。

conversation.ja_speaker: シェーン ブラウン
conversation.en_sentence: But there is no way peanuts can get into our products.
conversation.ja_sentence: でもうちの商品にピーナツが混入する事はないはずです。

conversation.ja_speaker: シェーン ブラウン
conversation.en_sentence: We don't even process anything that contains nuts at our factory.
conversation.ja_sentence: 我が社の工場ではナッツ配合の商品製造さえしていないです。

conversation.ja_speaker: シェーン ブラウン
conversation.en_sentence: If they really are peanuts, we would be in a bind.
conversation.ja_sentence: これが本当にピーナツなら厄介な事になります。

conversation.ja_speaker: シェーン ブラウン
conversation.en_sentence: You got the lot number on the product, right?.
conversation.ja_sentence: 商品のロット番号はもう知ってますよね？

conversation.ja_speaker: シェーン ブラウン
conversation.en_sentence: I need you to let Ms.Spencer know about it.
conversation.ja_sentence: スペンサーさんにそれを伝えて下さい。

conversation.ja_speaker: シェーン ブラウン
conversation.en_sentence: So she can provide us with the sample from the same batch.
conversation.ja_sentence: 同じバッチからサンプルを提供してくれますので。

conversation.ja_speaker: シェーン ブラウン
conversation.en_sentence: Also would you mind informing her on this whole situation?
conversation.ja_sentence: それから、彼女にこの一件について説明してもらっても良いですか？

conversation.ja_speaker: シェーン ブラウン
conversation.en_sentence: And let her know I will be forwarding those pictures to her as well.
conversation.ja_sentence: あと、私が写真を転送する事も伝えて下さい。

conversation.ja_speaker: ジョン マクマナス
conversation.en_sentence: Hi, this is John McManus from K trade.
conversation.ja_sentence: Kトレードのジョン マクマナスと申します。

conversation.ja_speaker: ジョン マクマナス
conversation.en_sentence: I am calling about your order that is supposed to be delivered next Monday.
conversation.ja_sentence: 来週配達予定のオーダーの件でお電話させてもらっています。

conversation.ja_speaker: ジョン マクマナス
conversation.en_sentence: I regret to inform you that we have to extend the delivery date.
conversation.ja_sentence: 大変申し訳ないのですが、配達日を延長させて頂きたいんです。

conversation.ja_speaker: ジョン マクマナス
conversation.en_sentence: Our warehouse was flooded during the recent tropical storm.
conversation.ja_sentence: 先日のトロピカルストームで我が社の倉庫が浸水被害を受けまして。

conversation.ja_speaker: ジョン マクマナス
conversation.en_sentence: Some of the inventory wasn't affected.
conversation.ja_sentence: 被害がなかった品もあります。

conversation.ja_speaker: ジョン マクマナス
conversation.en_sentence: But a lot of the items have water damage.
conversation.ja_sentence: ですが、大半の品は水浸しになってしまいました。

conversation.ja_speaker: ジョン マクマナス
conversation.en_sentence: Unfortunately, yours are also in unsellable condition.
conversation.ja_sentence: 残念ながら、御社の品も販売できる状態ではありません。

conversation.ja_speaker: ジョン マクマナス
conversation.en_sentence: I sincerely apologize for the inconvenience.
conversation.ja_sentence: ご迷惑をお掛けして、本当に申し訳ありません。

conversation.ja_speaker: ジョン マクマナス
conversation.en_sentence: Luckily, our office was spared.
conversation.ja_sentence: 幸いにも、我が社のオフィスは被害を免れました。

conversation.ja_speaker: ジョン マクマナス
conversation.en_sentence: None of our employees had any damage to their houses.
conversation.ja_sentence: 従業員も誰も家に被害がありませんでした。

conversation.ja_speaker: ジョン マクマナス
conversation.en_sentence: Our factory in China is shipping them out tomorrow.
conversation.ja_sentence: 中国の工場から明日送られてくる予定です。

conversation.ja_speaker: ジョン マクマナス
conversation.en_sentence: So we should receive them in 2 weeks.
conversation.ja_sentence: ですので、2週間ほどで到着する程です。

conversation.ja_speaker: ジョン マクマナス
conversation.en_sentence: We will do our best to get your items delivered as fast as possible.
conversation.ja_sentence: できるだけ早くお届けできますように全力を尽くします。

conversation.ja_speaker: ジョン マクマナス
conversation.en_sentence: As soon as it is shipped from our warehouse, we will send you a confirmation e-mail with a tracking number as usual.
conversation.ja_sentence: いつも通り、商品発送の際に追跡番号を含めた確認メールをお送り致します。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: What courses are you thinking of?
conversation.ja_sentence: 何のコースで考えてるんだい？

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: What does that course cover?
conversation.ja_sentence: どんな講義があるの？

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Let's see.
conversation.ja_sentence: どれどれ。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Honestly speaking, it might not be that useful.
conversation.ja_sentence: 正直言うと、これ、あんまり使えないかもよ。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Well, what you're learning and doing now at work is basically what the course covers.
conversation.ja_sentence: うーん、君が今職場で学んでることや、やってることが、基本的にこのコースで扱ってることだよね。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: If you want to learn something new, I would recommend an accounting course.
conversation.ja_sentence: 何か新しいことを学びたいんであれば、会計コースをおすすめするよ。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Or even a finance course.
conversation.ja_sentence: もしくは、財務のコースでもいい。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Once you become a manager, you will need to be good with your numbers.
conversation.ja_sentence: マネージャーになれば、数字に強くないといけないし。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: I think the company will eventually make you take some business courses down the road.
conversation.ja_sentence: 結局会社がさ、君にそのうちビジネスコースを受講させると思うけどね。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: So maybe you can even wait for those first then decide.
conversation.ja_sentence: だから先ずそれを待って、それから決めてもいいんじゃない。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: They might announce something in the next three months.
conversation.ja_sentence: 今後3か月の間に何かアナウンスするかもね。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: It's good to know you're interested in improving yourself.
conversation.ja_sentence: 君が自分磨きに興味があるってのを聞けて良かったよ。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: That would look impressive on your resume.
conversation.ja_sentence: 履歴書上は、すごく良いだろうね。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: But it does cost a lot of money to get one.
conversation.ja_sentence: でも、取得するのには大金がかかるよね。

conversation.en_sentence: Hey Debbie, did you get the group text I sent you earlier?
conversation.ja_sentence: デビーさん、先程送ったグループメールは届いていますか？

conversation.en_sentence: I haven't gotten a reply from you.
conversation.ja_sentence: 返事がまだ来てないので。

conversation.en_sentence: So I decided to give you a call.
conversation.ja_sentence: 直接電話する事にしました。

conversation.en_sentence: I was letting everybody know we will be closed due to inclement weather tomorrow.
conversation.ja_sentence: 悪天候の為、明日は臨時休業になった事を皆に知らせていたんです。

conversation.en_sentence: The storm is predicted to turn into a category 1 hurricane by the time it makes landfall here.
conversation.ja_sentence: ここに上陸する頃にはカテゴリー１のハリケーンになると予測されています。

conversation.en_sentence: Most schools and businesses will be closed too.
conversation.ja_sentence: ほとんどの学校、ビジネスは閉まるみたいです。

conversation.en_sentence: I don't think anything catastrophic will happen.
conversation.ja_sentence: 大被害は起こらないと思いますよ。

conversation.en_sentence: But we need to take precautions.
conversation.ja_sentence: でもちゃんと準備はしておいた方がいいですね。

conversation.en_sentence: No, it's too dangerous to be out and about tomorrow.
conversation.ja_sentence: いいえ、明日出回るなんて危険です。

conversation.en_sentence: But Tadashi and Ashton are boarding up the windows right now.
conversation.ja_sentence: でも今、忠さんとアシュトンさんが窓に板を張り付けている所です。

conversation.en_sentence: Mikey is getting some sandbags to keep water out.
conversation.ja_sentence: マイキーさんは浸水防止の為の土嚢を取りに行っています。

conversation.en_sentence: That would be wonderful.
conversation.ja_sentence: 宜しくお願いします。

conversation.en_sentence: You will be safe too!
conversation.ja_sentence: そちらも気を付けてくださいね！

conversation.en_sentence: No problem.
conversation.ja_sentence: どういたしまして。

conversation.en_sentence: This is my very first business trip out of country.
conversation.ja_sentence: 今回初めての海外出張なんです。

conversation.en_sentence: I am really thrilled.
conversation.ja_sentence: すごくワクワクしています。

conversation.en_sentence: What do you mean other than my job itself?
conversation.ja_sentence: 業務外とはどういう意味ですか？

conversation.en_sentence: I never had anyone depending on me with medications.
conversation.ja_sentence: 誰かの薬のお世話をしたことなんて今までありません。

conversation.en_sentence: So I am a little bit nervous about it.
conversation.ja_sentence: 少し緊張しますね。

conversation.en_sentence: What, are you serious?
conversation.ja_sentence: ええっ、本気ですか？

conversation.en_sentence: I never signed up for the "sleeping in your boss’s suite" job.
conversation.ja_sentence: 上司の部屋で寝る仕事になんて申し込んでないですよ。

conversation.en_sentence: So do I need to monitor him the entire time he is asleep?
conversation.ja_sentence: 彼が寝ている間ずっと監視しておかないといけないのですか？

conversation.en_sentence: I can do that for him.
conversation.ja_sentence: それは任せて下さい。

conversation.en_sentence: But my job should not entail giving him medications and sleeping in his suite.
conversation.ja_sentence: でも、投薬の手助けと彼のスイーツで寝る事は私の職務ではないはずです。

conversation.en_sentence: I would not feel comfortable.
conversation.ja_sentence: 居心地が悪いです。

conversation.en_sentence: I am just one of his employees, not his caregiver.
conversation.ja_sentence: 私は彼の従業員であって、お世話係ではないんです。

conversation.en_sentence: I hope this trip is not going to be too stressful.
conversation.ja_sentence: この出張でストレスが溜まらないといいんですが。

conversation.en_sentence: Wish me luck.
conversation.ja_sentence: 上手くいきますように。

conversation.en_sentence: Hello, University of A chemistry department.
conversation.ja_sentence: もしもし、A大学化学学科です。

conversation.en_sentence: This is him.
conversation.ja_sentence: 私ですが。

conversation.en_sentence: Sure, how may I help you?
conversation.ja_sentence: わかりました、どういった御用でしょうか？

conversation.en_sentence: We use a textbook, as well as labs where the students can have a hands on approach.
conversation.ja_sentence: 私たちは教科書だけでなく、生徒がハンズオンでアプローチすることができるラボを使用しています。

conversation.en_sentence: Our students did online homework with a previous textbook that we used, but the package was too expensive.
conversation.ja_sentence: 生徒達は以前使っていたテキストでオンラインで宿題をしていましたが、そのパッケージは高すぎまして。

conversation.en_sentence: That sounds great.
conversation.ja_sentence: それは素晴らしいですね。

conversation.en_sentence: A little too great.
conversation.ja_sentence: しかし話がうますぎませんか？

conversation.en_sentence: What's the catch?
conversation.ja_sentence: キャッチは何ですか？

conversation.en_sentence: Yes, I'm sitting at my desk looking at my computer right now.
conversation.ja_sentence: はい、今デスクに座っていてコンピューターの前におります。

conversation.en_sentence: How did you get my email address?
conversation.ja_sentence: 何故私のメールアドレスをご存知でしたか？

conversation.en_sentence: Oh, OK I was just a little surprised.
conversation.ja_sentence: ああ、そうでしたか、ちょっと驚きました。

conversation.en_sentence: Yes, I see the link that you emailed me here in my inbox.
conversation.ja_sentence: はい、メールしていただいたリンクを受信ボックスに確認いたしました。

conversation.en_sentence: Sure thing Bob.
conversation.ja_sentence: 了解です、ボブさん。

conversation.en_sentence: Can it have any kind of content I want?
conversation.ja_sentence: 自分で好きなコンテンツをなんでも選べるのですか？

conversation.ja_speaker: ナンシー ウィルソンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Of course, William.
conversation.ja_sentence: もちろんです、ウィリアムさん。

conversation.ja_speaker: ナンシー ウィルソンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Busy as always, but all things considered, it's going well, I think.
conversation.ja_sentence: 相変わらず忙しいですが、色々考えても、うまくいってるほうだと思います。

conversation.ja_speaker: ナンシー ウィルソンさん
conversation.en_sentence: How are you?
conversation.ja_sentence: そちらはどうですか？

conversation.ja_speaker: ナンシー ウィルソンさん
conversation.en_sentence: This year has been a good year, not as crazy as last year, but steady.
conversation.ja_sentence: 今年はいい年です、去年ほど忙しくないけど、安定していて。

conversation.ja_speaker: ナンシー ウィルソンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Thank you, William, I am please with my team as well.
conversation.ja_sentence: ウィリアムさん、ありがとうございます、私も自分のチームには満足しています。

conversation.ja_speaker: ナンシー ウィルソンさん
conversation.en_sentence: We work really well together.
conversation.ja_sentence: 私たちは本当によいチームワークで働きます。

conversation.ja_speaker: ナンシー ウィルソンさん
conversation.en_sentence: No major drama this year and we have a very cohesive working environment.
conversation.ja_sentence: 今年は大きなもめごとなどもなく、とても団結力のある職場環境を保っています。

conversation.ja_speaker: ナンシー ウィルソンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Thank you.
conversation.ja_sentence: ありがとうございます。

conversation.ja_speaker: ナンシー ウィルソンさん
conversation.en_sentence: By the way, what do you think about Chris, our new hire?
conversation.ja_sentence: ところで、新人のクリスさんについてはどう思いますか？

conversation.ja_speaker: ナンシー ウィルソンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Yes, she's a very cautious worker but very attentive.
conversation.ja_sentence: ええ、非常に慎重な仕事をする人ですが、大変気配りもできます。

conversation.ja_speaker: ナンシー ウィルソンさん
conversation.en_sentence: I need to get her up to speed with the project so she can get more involved, what do you think?
conversation.ja_sentence: もっと関わりを増やして欲しいので、彼女にはもっとプロジェクトのスピードについていけるようになってもらう必要があるのですが、どう思いますか？

conversation.ja_speaker: ナンシー ウィルソンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Good idea, I was thinking that myself!
conversation.ja_sentence: いいですね、私もそう思ってたんです！

conversation.ja_speaker: ナンシー ウィルソンさん
conversation.en_sentence: I will speak to Tom after this.
conversation.ja_sentence: この後でトムさんに話してみます。

conversation.ja_speaker: ナンシー ウィルソンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Should we look at the numbers?
conversation.ja_sentence: 数字を見たほうがいいですか？

conversation.en_sentence: I haven't decided.
conversation.ja_sentence: まだ、決めてません。

conversation.en_sentence: Why do you ask?
conversation.ja_sentence: どうしてですか？

conversation.en_sentence: Yeah, I think I still have ten days left this year.
conversation.ja_sentence: そうなんです、今年はまだあと10日も残ってます。

conversation.en_sentence: They carry over right?
conversation.ja_sentence: 来年に持ち越せますよね？

conversation.en_sentence: Yeah I want to go somewhere, but I just don't have the money right now.
conversation.ja_sentence: どこかへ行きたいとは思っているんですが、今はお金がないんですよ。

conversation.en_sentence: I just got married, and I have a bunch of other expenses to deal with.
conversation.ja_sentence: 結婚したばかりだし、お金を使う予定が他に山ほどあるんです。

conversation.en_sentence: I'm almost done the loan on my car though.
conversation.ja_sentence: 車のローン返済はもうすぐ終わりそうですけどね。

conversation.en_sentence: It's done in August this year.
conversation.ja_sentence: 今年の8月で。

conversation.en_sentence: Yes, that's right.
conversation.ja_sentence: そうです。

conversation.en_sentence: I pay around five hundred dollars.
conversation.ja_sentence: 500ドルくらいです。

conversation.en_sentence: So I'll be able to save a lot more once I get that out of the way.
conversation.ja_sentence: なので、これが終わればかなり貯金できます。

conversation.en_sentence: I have to start thinking about the future too.
conversation.ja_sentence: 将来のことも考えないといけないし。

conversation.en_sentence: Yeah, like kids.
conversation.ja_sentence: そう、子供とか。

conversation.en_sentence: Oh, I don't want to think about it.
conversation.ja_sentence: えー、それは考えたくないですね。

conversation.en_sentence: Thank you so much for hosting this lunch for me John.
conversation.ja_sentence: 今日は、私のためにランチ会を開いてくれてありがとう、ジョンさん。

conversation.en_sentence: You were hanging around for what, like 5 hours before anyone talked to you?
conversation.ja_sentence: 誰かが話しかけてくれるまで、えっと、５時間くらいうろうろしてたのよね？

conversation.en_sentence: It was crazy back then, and it was such a small operation.
conversation.ja_sentence: あのころはクレイジーだったわね、小規模な経営で。

conversation.en_sentence: Everyone had like 950 things to do a day.
conversation.ja_sentence: 一日に一人当たり９５０個くらいやることがあった。

conversation.en_sentence: I've already sent out most of my stuff, but I won't be landing there until next month.
conversation.ja_sentence: もうほとんどの持ち物は送ったけど、来月まで向こうには着かないわ。

conversation.en_sentence: I'm traveling to London first to attend Schuyler's wedding.
conversation.ja_sentence: スカイラーの結婚式に出るために、まずロンドンに行くから。

conversation.en_sentence: Yeah, Vaughn really liked him and nominated him to a managerial position.
conversation.ja_sentence: そう、ヴォーンが彼のことをすごく気に入って、管理職のポジションに薦めたのよね。

conversation.en_sentence: All of a sudden he's making a lot of money, buys a house and decides to fill it with another human being!
conversation.ja_sentence: 突然、お金を稼ぎだして、家を買って、別の人間と一緒にそこに入ることに決めたのよ！

conversation.en_sentence: Tomorrow.
conversation.ja_sentence: 明日。

conversation.en_sentence: That's fine.
conversation.ja_sentence: 別にいいわよ。

conversation.en_sentence: I've never expected anything from them, so it's fine.
conversation.ja_sentence: 彼らからは何も期待してないから、いいわよ。

conversation.en_sentence: I wanted to be in the company of people I love and respect.
conversation.ja_sentence: 私が好きで尊敬できる人たちと一緒にいたかったから。

conversation.en_sentence: Oh, stop it Eugina!
conversation.ja_sentence: もう、やめてよ、ユージニア！

conversation.en_sentence: Oh, John, since our closest colleagues are here, do you want to…?
conversation.ja_sentence: ああ、ジョンさん、ここは一番近しい同僚たちばかりだから、言っちゃう？

conversation.en_sentence: Well, I think I managed today's board meeting well.
conversation.ja_sentence: さて、今日の役員会はうまく行ったと思いますが。

conversation.en_sentence: What Alex and Sylar were saying were completely misguided, don't you think?
conversation.ja_sentence: アレックスとサイラーが言っていたことは全くもって見当違いだと思いませんか？

conversation.en_sentence: It's not that simple Vaughn, our company is not like others.
conversation.ja_sentence: ヴォーンさん、そんなにシンプルではないでしょう、うちの会社は他とは違いますから。

conversation.en_sentence: We have R&D and if our discovery is a failure, we can't really project, can we?
conversation.ja_sentence: うちには研究開発があって、発見に失敗すれば予測が出来ません、そうですよね。

conversation.en_sentence: Well, we are not as big as other companies with R&D.
conversation.ja_sentence: でも、うちは他の研究開発のある会社ほど大きくないですからね。

conversation.en_sentence: We have less cash flow and assets and that is why it is so difficult to run this company.
conversation.ja_sentence: キャッシュフローも資産も少ないので、この会社を経営するのは難しいんですよ。

conversation.en_sentence: Exactly, I really feel like all they think about is money.
conversation.ja_sentence: まさにそうです、本当に、彼らの考えることと言ったらお金のことばかりだと思うわ。

conversation.en_sentence: They are blinded by our potential IPO and that seems to be all they care about.
conversation.ja_sentence: 彼らは、株式公開の可能性に目がくらんでいて、そればかり気にしているように思えます。

conversation.en_sentence: A huge windfall for them, courtesy of us!
conversation.ja_sentence: 私たちのおかげで大儲け！

conversation.en_sentence: Anyway, at the end of the day, I think our investors are positive about us.
conversation.ja_sentence: とにかく、結局のところ、うちの投資家たちは私たちを前向きにとらえてくれていると思います。

conversation.en_sentence: I've had nothing but good feedback for my work in research and development.
conversation.ja_sentence: 私の研究開発の仕事に対しては、よい意見しか聞いていません。

conversation.en_sentence: They invested in us because of our solid research and numerous patents.
conversation.ja_sentence: 私たちのしっかりとした研究と多くの特許のために投資をしてくれているのですから。

conversation.en_sentence: Our assets are safe so I really wouldn't worry too much about our investors right now.
conversation.ja_sentence: 私たちの資産は安全ですから、今投資家のことを心配し過ぎなくてもいいでしょう。

conversation.en_sentence: We have bigger fish to fry.
conversation.ja_sentence: 他にもっと大切なことがありますよ。

conversation.en_sentence: I am still cringing.
conversation.ja_sentence: 思い出してもうんざりするわ。

conversation.en_sentence: All they talked about was IPO and how much money there is to be made.
conversation.ja_sentence: 彼らが話すことって株式公開とどれだけお金が稼げるかっていうことだけだった。

conversation.en_sentence: I was just sitting there thinking, how embarrassing are they?
conversation.ja_sentence: 座りながら、何て恥ずかしい人たち、とばかり考えてたわ。

conversation.en_sentence: As long as those 2 are CEO and CFO, I don't think we will ever go public.
conversation.ja_sentence: 二人がCEOとCFOでいる限り、株式公開なんて無理じゃない。

conversation.en_sentence: I'm sorry to give it to you while you are still new here, but this is a badly managed company.
conversation.ja_sentence: まだここでは新人のあなたに言うのも悪いんだけど、この会社、経営がひどいのよ。

conversation.en_sentence: Everyone knows this except for the new hires and management.
conversation.ja_sentence: 新規採用と経営陣以外は皆知ってるわ。

conversation.en_sentence: The patents and technology we have are amazing, probably one of the best in the world, and the speed at which the lab works is unbelievable, but this company is probably not going to survive.
conversation.ja_sentence: うちの特許と技術は素晴らしくて、多分世界でもトップに入るし、研究所の仕事のスピードも信じられないくらいなんだけど、この会社はきっと長続きしないわ。

conversation.en_sentence: They have zero sales experience.
conversation.ja_sentence: 彼ら、全然営業の経験がないんですよね。

conversation.en_sentence: They don't really understand how sales work.
conversation.ja_sentence: 営業がどういう風に機能するのかほとんど分かっていないのよ。

conversation.en_sentence: They can't grasp the idea that we need to build and maintain a relationship with our B2B clients, and instead veer towards the immediate gratification of seeing retail customers' purchases because the figures are all there, online, for them to see real time.
conversation.ja_sentence: 法人顧客との関係を構築して維持する必要があるってことが分からなくて、代わりに、オンラインでリアルタイムで数字を全部見られるという、すぐに見返りのあるリテール消費者の購入に方向性を変えているのよね。

conversation.en_sentence: And that's the reason we are losing our B2C customers as well.
conversation.ja_sentence: あと、それが個人消費者も失っていってる理由なんだよね。

conversation.en_sentence: Dr. Toshinaga doesn't listen to our customers' feedback or complaints, brushing them off as anomalies.
conversation.ja_sentence: 利永さんは消費者の意見や苦情を聞こうとしないからね、それは例外だと言ってはねのけちゃって。

conversation.en_sentence: She flat out said that our customers aren't smart and that she could manipulate them.
conversation.ja_sentence: 彼女、うちのお客さんは賢くなくて、操作できる、ってきっぱり言ってたもんね。

conversation.en_sentence: Our customers may not have a PhD like her, but they are smart enough to stop buying from us when they feel they are being slighted.
conversation.ja_sentence: 私たちのお客さんたち、彼女みたいに博士号は持ってないかも知れないけど、馬鹿にされてるのが分かったら私たちから買うのをやめるくらいには賢いからね。

conversation.en_sentence: I am excited to talk about all the things we have planned for this year.
conversation.ja_sentence: 今年度の計画についてお話しできて嬉しいです。

conversation.en_sentence: Mr. Ko will explain our financial goals first.
conversation.ja_sentence: まずは、高さんから財務目標について話してもらいましょう。

conversation.en_sentence: Yes Won Bin, what is it?
conversation.ja_sentence: ええ、ウォンビンさん、何でしょう。

conversation.en_sentence: We run the lab with not enough people, so it's hard to stay on track with development.
conversation.ja_sentence: うちの研究室は人材不足なので、開発が遅れないようにするのが難しいのです。

conversation.en_sentence: Right now we are focusing on renewing our B2C product, and we have 3 scientists working on that, taking away time from their other obligations.
conversation.ja_sentence: 現在、個人向け製品の改良に注力し、科学者３人を担当させているのですが、それによって彼らは他の業務をやる時間がなくなっています。

conversation.en_sentence: It's hard to find the right people.
conversation.ja_sentence: 適した人材を探すのが難しいんですよね。

conversation.en_sentence: Yes, Solomon?
conversation.ja_sentence: でしょ、ソロモンさん？

conversation.en_sentence: Let me give you an example.
conversation.ja_sentence: 例を挙げてみましょうか。

conversation.en_sentence: I used to work with Emmit Monk at D research.
conversation.ja_sentence: D研究所のエミット モンクさんと働いていたことがあります。

conversation.en_sentence: You know him right?
conversation.ja_sentence: 彼のことはご存知ですよね？

conversation.en_sentence: He came up with the idea of waterproof glue that turns into rubber with his partner and taken his company public.
conversation.ja_sentence: ゴムに変わる防水接着剤というアイデアをパートナーと思いつき、会社の株式を公開しました。

conversation.en_sentence: He put up 40 thousand dollars to set up his company and made 120 million with IPO.
conversation.ja_sentence: ４万ドルの資金で会社を設立し、株式公開によって１億２千万ドル儲けたのです。

conversation.en_sentence: Like I mentioned, we are in the process of coming out with a new version of our B2C product.
conversation.ja_sentence: 私が言ったように、新しいバージョンの個人向け商品を生み出す過程にあります。

conversation.en_sentence: That should wow them enough for sales to pick up.
conversation.ja_sentence: それによって、彼らを驚かし、売上が伸びると思いますよ。

conversation.ja_speaker: トニー ジェームソンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Not at all.
conversation.ja_sentence: どういたしまして。

conversation.ja_speaker: トニー ジェームソンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Thank you guys for coming.
conversation.ja_sentence: ようこそお越しくださいました。

conversation.ja_speaker: トニー ジェームソンさん
conversation.en_sentence: It's nice to meet you Mr. Sano.
conversation.ja_sentence: はじめまして、佐野さん。

conversation.ja_speaker: トニー ジェームソンさん
conversation.en_sentence: That sounds good.
conversation.ja_sentence: ええ、いいですよ。

conversation.ja_speaker: トニー ジェームソンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Do you have offices in North America?
conversation.ja_sentence: 北米にもオフィスはありますか？

conversation.ja_speaker: トニー ジェームソンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Okay, please go on.
conversation.ja_sentence: 分かりました、続けてください。

conversation.ja_speaker: トニー ジェームソンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Very interesting.
conversation.ja_sentence: 大変興味深いですね。

conversation.ja_speaker: トニー ジェームソンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Is this because of the import tariffs that the US has set up?
conversation.ja_sentence: それはアメリカが設定した輸入関税が原因でしょうか？

conversation.ja_speaker: トニー ジェームソンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Is there a reason why you want a co-investor rather than going in alone?
conversation.ja_sentence: 単独ではなく共同投資を望まれる理由は？

conversation.ja_speaker: トニー ジェームソンさん
conversation.en_sentence: That's understandable.
conversation.ja_sentence: それはよく分かります。

conversation.ja_speaker: トニー ジェームソンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Can I actually bring our CEO in?
conversation.ja_sentence: うちのCEOを呼んできていいですか？

conversation.ja_speaker: トニー ジェームソンさん
conversation.en_sentence: I think he should be involved in a topic like this.
conversation.ja_sentence: こういう内容なら、彼も参加したほうがいいと思うので。

conversation.ja_speaker: トニー ジェームソンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Thank you.
conversation.ja_sentence: 分かりました。

conversation.ja_speaker: トニー ジェームソンさん
conversation.en_sentence: I'll be right back.
conversation.ja_sentence: すぐに戻りますね。

conversation.en_sentence: Hi Ian, this is Sam from Company A.
conversation.ja_sentence: やあ、イアン、A会社のサムだよ。

conversation.en_sentence: How are you doing?
conversation.ja_sentence: 元気？

conversation.en_sentence: I've been good.
conversation.ja_sentence: 元気だよ。

conversation.en_sentence: A bit busy but good.
conversation.ja_sentence: 忙しいけど、何とかね。

conversation.en_sentence: There's some shipment changes and I need to change the trucking schedule a bit.
conversation.ja_sentence: 運送に関する変更があって、トラックのスケジュールを少し変えないといけないんだ。

conversation.en_sentence: And there's one that needs to be trucked out tomorrow.
conversation.ja_sentence: それで明日運搬されないといけないものが1つあるんだ。

conversation.en_sentence: Do you think you can arrange this?
conversation.ja_sentence: 手配できるかな？

conversation.en_sentence: I need two trucks.
conversation.ja_sentence: 2台だよ。

conversation.en_sentence: Perfect.
conversation.ja_sentence: 良かった。

conversation.en_sentence: Thank you so much.
conversation.ja_sentence: ありがとう。

conversation.en_sentence: I'll send out a revised trucking request by email later today.
conversation.ja_sentence: 今日この後、トラック輸送リクエストを訂正したものをEメールで送るよ。

conversation.en_sentence: No, that will be all.
conversation.ja_sentence: いや、これだけだよ。

conversation.en_sentence: Again, really appreciate your support.
conversation.ja_sentence: 改めて、助けてくれて本当に感謝してる。

conversation.en_sentence: Talk to you soon.
conversation.ja_sentence: じゃあ、また。

conversation.en_sentence: Hi Arthur, this is Sam from the Seattle office.
conversation.ja_sentence: やあアーサー、シアトル支社のサムだよ。

conversation.en_sentence: I'm good thank you.
conversation.ja_sentence: うん、元気だよ。

conversation.en_sentence: I actually just sent you an email in regards to an NDA.
conversation.ja_sentence: 機密保持契約に関するEメールを送ったところなんだけど。

conversation.en_sentence: I was wondering if you would be able to take a look.
conversation.ja_sentence: 目を通してもらえないかと思ってね。

conversation.en_sentence: So let me explain a bit about this business.
conversation.ja_sentence: それで、このビジネスについてちょっと説明したいんだ。

conversation.en_sentence: We are planning to build a new facility in Canada and Company A will be a co-investor.
conversation.ja_sentence: カナダに新しい施設を作る計画をしてて、A会社が共同投資することになってる。

conversation.en_sentence: They will also help us with material sourcing.
conversation.ja_sentence: 資材の供給も援助してくれるらしくてね。

conversation.en_sentence: So we need this NDA to make sure that they don't leak the information if they decide to back out.
conversation.ja_sentence: だから、もしA会社が契約をキャンセルするってなった時に情報を漏らさないよう、この契約書が必要なんだ。

conversation.en_sentence: What's the obligation period after terminating the NDA?
conversation.ja_sentence: 契約終了後の義務期間はどのくらいだい？

conversation.en_sentence: Would one year be too short?
conversation.ja_sentence: 1年だと短すぎるかな？

conversation.en_sentence: Great.
conversation.ja_sentence: 了解。

conversation.en_sentence: Thank you very much for your help.
conversation.ja_sentence: 手伝ってくれて本当にありがとう。

conversation.en_sentence: Will do.
conversation.ja_sentence: わかった。

conversation.en_sentence: Bye now.
conversation.ja_sentence: じゃあ。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: So are all the meetings confirmed for the business trip at the end of the month?
conversation.ja_sentence: それで、今月末の出張中の会議の予定は全て決まったかい？

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Can you start booking the flights and car rental as well?
conversation.ja_sentence: 航空券とレンタカーの予約も取り始めてくれる？

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: No I can do that myself.
conversation.ja_sentence: 大丈夫、自分でやるよ。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Just book your own flight.
conversation.ja_sentence: 自分の分のフライトだけ取ればいいよ。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Oh, be sure to choose a refundable fare.
conversation.ja_sentence: あ、返金可能のチケットを選んでね。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Yes, but sometimes we need to change our flight last minute or even cancel depending on the weather.
conversation.ja_sentence: そうだね、でも時々直前にフライト変更をしたり天気によってキャンセルしたりしないとならない時もあるし。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: It would be more expensive and a hassle if that happens.
conversation.ja_sentence: そうなればもっとお金も手間もかかる。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Don't worry, it's better to pay more than to not be able to go on the business trip due to delays or cancellations.
conversation.ja_sentence: 心配しないで、遅延とかキャンセルで出張に行けなくなるよりはもっとお金を払っておいた方がマシだよ。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: That's right.
conversation.ja_sentence: その通り。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Especially if we are travelling with clients.
conversation.ja_sentence: クライアントと旅行する時は特にね。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: The clients are coming from Japan just for these meetings so we have to make sure everything goes well.
conversation.ja_sentence: この会議のためだけに日本から取引先の方々がいらっしゃるので全て順調に進むようにしなくてはいけないね。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Then we should think about driving if the distance makes sense.
conversation.ja_sentence: その場合はそんなに遠くないのであれば車で行こう。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Or drive to a different airport that is less affected by the weather.
conversation.ja_sentence: それか天気の影響が少ない他の空港に車で移動しよう。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: It's important to have more than one option.
conversation.ja_sentence: 選択肢を一つ以上考えるのが大事だね。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: The simple answer to that is find a demand and fill that demand.
conversation.ja_sentence: 簡単に言うと、需要を見つけて、その需要を満たすってことだね。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: But obviously it's not that easy.
conversation.ja_sentence: しかし当然、言うほど単純ではないんだ。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: You will need to find a supply source, and if the price is competitive or not.
conversation.ja_sentence: 供給元や、その価格が競争力が高いかどうかを見極めないといけない。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: You either have to find a cheaper product, or a brand new product.
conversation.ja_sentence: より安い製品を見つけるか、まったくの新製品を見つけたりしないといけない。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Yeah, I'm sure all the big players already have access to good suppliers.
conversation.ja_sentence: そう、大手企業はすでに良いサプライヤーを利用しているしね。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Well funny story.
conversation.ja_sentence: 実は、面白い話なんだ。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Our customer who buys product from here, started making a new product.
conversation.ja_sentence: うちから製品を買っているお客さんが新製品を作り始めたんだ。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: And I realized that there was a shortage of that product in North America.
conversation.ja_sentence: それで、その製品が北米では不足しているってことに気づいた。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: So our customer became our supplier.
conversation.ja_sentence: で、そのお客さんがサプライヤーになったんだよ。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Yeah, exactly.
conversation.ja_sentence: そう、そのとおり。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: It'll be much easier to keep the deal exclusive.
conversation.ja_sentence: 独占取引を維持するのはもっと簡単だろうね。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Another advice is to stay up to date on what's happening in the market.
conversation.ja_sentence: もう一つは、市場がどうなっているか常に最新情報を入手しておくことだね。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Read the industry websites, and just stay updated on current events.
conversation.ja_sentence: 業界のサイトを見たり、時事問題をキャッチしていることだ。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: You never know what might come up.
conversation.ja_sentence: どんなことが起きるか予測できないからね。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Well I think we need to think about what we can gain by working with them.
conversation.ja_sentence: えー、取引で何が得られるのか考えた方がいいのではないでしょうか？

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Eventually, we need to explain to our management.
conversation.ja_sentence: 最終的にはウチの経営陣に説明しないといけないですから。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: They always want to know what synergies there are.
conversation.ja_sentence: どんな相乗効果があるのか知りたがりますね。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Well we have assets and trading operations so it only makes sense to leverage that.
conversation.ja_sentence: ただ当社には資産と商取引業務がありますので、投資をテコにするのは意味がありますよね。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Well, I guess we will have to explain to them really well that this is a new and growing industry that will benefit our company.
conversation.ja_sentence: えー、これが新しくて成長している業界で、当社に有益だということをかなり上手く説明する必要がありますね。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: He's better than us.
conversation.ja_sentence: 我々より上手ですよ。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: That's for sure.
conversation.ja_sentence: それは確かです。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Okay.
conversation.ja_sentence: いいですよ。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Hey Sam, can you come over now?
conversation.ja_sentence: サム、ちょっと、こっちに来てくれるか？

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: But there is really no other way but to make a pure investment first to get our foot in the door.
conversation.ja_sentence: ですが、足がかりを得るには純粋な投資から始めるほかに、策はないですよ。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Like industry growth, market size, major players, things like that.
conversation.ja_sentence: 例えば、業界の伸び、市場規模、主要企業といったことかな。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Yeah it will be.
conversation.ja_sentence: うん、そうだね。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: That would be a good start.
conversation.ja_sentence: スタートとしては良さそうだ。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Make sure you keep note of where you get the information from.
conversation.ja_sentence: 情報の出所を忘れずにメモしておいてくれ。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Hey Sam, are you busy this afternoon?
conversation.ja_sentence: ちょっとサム、今日の午後忙しい？

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Is that a yes or no?
conversation.ja_sentence: それは忙しいの、忙しくないの？

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: I'm visiting some suppliers in the afternoon so I was thinking it would be a good opportunity for you to meet them.
conversation.ja_sentence: 今日の午後、サプライヤーのところに行くんで、いい機会だから君も会ったらどうかと思うんだけど。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: I need to discuss prices for the next quarter.
conversation.ja_sentence: 来四半期の価格交渉だよ。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: I think it would be good for you to experience the negotiations.
conversation.ja_sentence: 君は交渉を経験しておいた方がいいと思うんだ。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: I want you to just listen and see how I deal with the customers.
conversation.ja_sentence: 聞いているだけでいいから、僕が顧客対応するのを見てて欲しいんだ。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Also, I'd like you to write the meeting minutes.
conversation.ja_sentence: それと、議事録を書いてくれるかな。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Kind of.
conversation.ja_sentence: そうかも。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: It's kind of hard talking and taking notes at the same time.
conversation.ja_sentence: 話ししながら、同時にメモをとるのは大変なんだよ。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: So we'll head out after lunch.
conversation.ja_sentence: じゃあ、昼食の後に出かけるとしよう。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: How about I buy you lunch today?
conversation.ja_sentence: 今日は、僕のおごりっていうのはどう？

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Let's head out now then.
conversation.ja_sentence: じゃあ、もう行こうか。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: I don't want to deal with the lunch rush.
conversation.ja_sentence: 昼時は混むから避けたいんで。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: We won't come back to the office so take your stuff.
conversation.ja_sentence: 今日は直帰になるから、荷物は持って行ってね。

conversation.ja_speaker: リック バセットさん
conversation.en_sentence: This is the data analysis of our product.
conversation.ja_sentence: こちらは当社製品のデータ分析です。

conversation.ja_speaker: リック バセットさん
conversation.en_sentence: As you can see, our moisture content is around seven percent.
conversation.ja_sentence: ご覧の通り、水分含量は約７パーセントです。

conversation.ja_speaker: リック バセットさん
conversation.en_sentence: And our ash content is usually around two point five percent.
conversation.ja_sentence: そして、通常、灰分は約２.５パーセントです。

conversation.ja_speaker: リック バセットさん
conversation.en_sentence: Oh, why is that?
conversation.ja_sentence: えっ、どうしてですか？

conversation.ja_speaker: リック バセットさん
conversation.en_sentence: So they could use it if they adjust their settings?
conversation.ja_sentence: ということは、設定を変えれば使えるということですよね。

conversation.ja_speaker: リック バセットさん
conversation.en_sentence: Well, do you think they would be willing to change the settings to be able to use our product?
conversation.ja_sentence: えーと、当社製品を使えるようにわざわざ設定を変えてくれるでしょうか？

conversation.ja_speaker: リック バセットさん
conversation.en_sentence: Do you have any idea what the price will have to be?
conversation.ja_sentence: どれくらいの価格になるかわかりますか？

conversation.ja_speaker: リック バセットさん
conversation.en_sentence: Ten percent is pretty big.
conversation.ja_sentence: １割とはかなりですね。

conversation.ja_speaker: リック バセットさん
conversation.en_sentence: Are there other ways we can make this work?
conversation.ja_sentence: 現状でいけるようにするには、他に何か手立てはありますかね？

conversation.ja_speaker: リック バセットさん
conversation.en_sentence: So like a small penalty if it goes over?
conversation.ja_sentence: つまり、基準を超えた場合は若干のペナルティということですね。

conversation.ja_speaker: リック バセットさん
conversation.en_sentence: Let me talk to our manufacturing team.
conversation.ja_sentence: 製造チームと相談させてください。

conversation.ja_speaker: リック バセットさん
conversation.en_sentence: Maybe they can figure out a way to keep the ash content under two point five percent.
conversation.ja_sentence: おそらく、灰分を２.５パーセント未満に維持する方法があるんじゃないかな。

conversation.ja_speaker: リック バセットさん
conversation.en_sentence: I mean, we are currently hovering around that mark so maybe we can adjust some things on our side.
conversation.ja_sentence: というのは、今のところ基準を若干上下しているだけなので、こちらで何かを調節できるかもしれません。

conversation.ja_speaker: リック バセットさん
conversation.en_sentence: Will do.
conversation.ja_sentence: ご連絡します。

conversation.en_sentence: Hi Jim, how are you?
conversation.ja_sentence: ああ、ジム、お元気ですか？

conversation.en_sentence: Not a problem.
conversation.ja_sentence: いえ、どういたしまして。

conversation.en_sentence: What's the market price lately?
conversation.ja_sentence: 最近の市場価格は？

conversation.en_sentence: Just to confirm, is this US dollars?
conversation.ja_sentence: 確認ですけど、それ米ドルですよね？

conversation.en_sentence: My understanding is that the product from here is higher quality so it will be higher than the market price.
conversation.ja_sentence: こちらから出荷する製品は高品質ですので、市場価格よりは高めになっていると理解しておりますが。

conversation.en_sentence: I will try.
conversation.ja_sentence: やってみます。

conversation.en_sentence: Let me talk with the supplier and get back to you.
conversation.ja_sentence: サプライヤーと話をして、折り返しご連絡します。

conversation.en_sentence: Talk to you soon.
conversation.ja_sentence: では、また。

conversation.en_sentence: That was Jim from the Shanghai office.
conversation.ja_sentence: 上海オフィスのジムです。

conversation.en_sentence: He was saying that the price we offered him was higher than the market price.
conversation.ja_sentence: こちらからオファーした価格が市場価格より高いと言ってきました。

conversation.en_sentence: We took around hundred dollars per metric ton.
conversation.ja_sentence: １トンにつき、100ドルです。

conversation.en_sentence: Alright.
conversation.ja_sentence: わかりました。

conversation.en_sentence: I'll offer him seven hundred and fifty dollars then.
conversation.ja_sentence: では、７５０ドルでオファーしてみます。

conversation.en_sentence: Okay, I'll come up with something.
conversation.ja_sentence: わかりました、何かもっと考えてみます。

conversation.en_sentence: Hi Jay this is Sam from Company A.
conversation.ja_sentence: もしもし、A社のサムです。

conversation.en_sentence: I'm good thank you.
conversation.ja_sentence: 大丈夫です、どうも。

conversation.en_sentence: I'm just calling in regards to the payment for last month's shipment.

conversation.en_sentence: Yes that would be Lot A.
conversation.ja_sentence: そうです、ロットAの件です。

conversation.en_sentence: My admin department just informed me that they haven't received the payment for it yet.
conversation.ja_sentence: まだお支払いを受けとっていないと弊社の総務部から言われておりまして。

conversation.en_sentence: So I just wanted to follow up and see when the payment will be made.
conversation.ja_sentence: どうなっているのか、または、いつ頃お支払いいただけるのか、確認させていただきたいのですが。

conversation.en_sentence: Sure.
conversation.ja_sentence: はい。

conversation.en_sentence: Did they say when they will be able to process it?
conversation.ja_sentence: いつ頃処理していただけるか、おっしゃっていましたか？

conversation.en_sentence: Great.
conversation.ja_sentence: それなら良かった。

conversation.en_sentence: Thank you for your help.
conversation.ja_sentence: どうもお世話様でした。

conversation.en_sentence: Not a problem.

conversation.en_sentence: No I think I'm good.
conversation.ja_sentence: いえ、ないと思います。

conversation.en_sentence: Thank you.
conversation.ja_sentence: どうも。

conversation.en_sentence: Talk to you soon.
conversation.ja_sentence: また。

conversation.ja_speaker: ブルース 中島さん
conversation.en_sentence: So Sam, I am meeting with Company A next week.
conversation.ja_sentence: あのね、サムさん、来週A社と会うことになっているんですよ。

conversation.en_sentence: I know it's last minute but can you prepare a business proposal for me?

conversation.en_sentence: Oh did I not include you in the emails?
conversation.ja_sentence: あ、メールを送ってなかったですか？

conversation.ja_speaker: ブルース 中島さん
conversation.en_sentence: Oops I must have forgotten.
conversation.ja_sentence: あらら、すっかり忘れてたようです。

conversation.ja_speaker: ブルース 中島さん
conversation.en_sentence: I'll send you the email later then.
conversation.ja_sentence: じゃ、後でメール送ります。

conversation.ja_speaker: ブルース 中島さん
conversation.en_sentence: I actually drew what I want on the proposal on this piece of paper.
conversation.ja_sentence: 実は、提案書に入れたいことをこの紙に記入しておいたんですよ。

conversation.ja_speaker: ブルース 中島さん
conversation.en_sentence: It's going to be composed of three parts.
conversation.ja_sentence: 三つの部分から成り立ちます。

conversation.ja_speaker: ブルース 中島さん
conversation.en_sentence: The first part will be the company presentation, followed by information on the market.
conversation.ja_sentence: 始めの部分は会社についてのプレゼンで、そこから市場についての情報に移ります。

conversation.ja_speaker: ブルース 中島さん
conversation.en_sentence: That's what I wanted to discuss with you.
conversation.ja_sentence: そこをあなたに相談したかったんです。

conversation.ja_speaker: ブルース 中島さん
conversation.en_sentence: What do you think should it be?
conversation.ja_sentence: どうするのがいいと思いますか？

conversation.ja_speaker: ブルース 中島さん
conversation.en_sentence: Yeah of course.
conversation.ja_sentence: ええ、もちろん。

conversation.ja_speaker: ブルース 中島さん
conversation.en_sentence: Sounds great.
conversation.ja_sentence: 助かります。

conversation.ja_speaker: ブルース 中島さん
conversation.en_sentence: I'll keep thinking of what to put on the proposal.
conversation.ja_sentence: 提案書に入れたいことを引き続き考えておきますね。

conversation.ja_speaker: ジェイ トレヴィーノさん
conversation.en_sentence: Not a problem.
conversation.ja_sentence: 大丈夫ですよ。

conversation.ja_speaker: ジェイ トレヴィーノさん
conversation.en_sentence: It is currently 8 o'clock in the evening.
conversation.ja_sentence: 夜の８時です。

conversation.ja_speaker: ジェイ トレヴィーノさん
conversation.en_sentence: Don't worry, I already ate dinner.

conversation.ja_speaker: ジェイ トレヴィーノさん
conversation.en_sentence: What time is it in Tokyo now?
conversation.ja_sentence: 東京は今何時なんですか？

conversation.ja_speaker: ジェイ トレヴィーノさん
conversation.en_sentence: Ah, the day is just getting started then.
conversation.ja_sentence: あ、まだ一日が始まったところですね。

conversation.ja_speaker: ジェイ トレヴィーノさん
conversation.en_sentence: That's correct.
conversation.ja_sentence: その通りです。

conversation.ja_speaker: ジェイ トレヴィーノさん
conversation.en_sentence: We currently have our rail cars serviced by another company right now.
conversation.ja_sentence: 現在、弊社は鉄道車両整備を外注しています。

conversation.ja_speaker: ジェイ トレヴィーノさん
conversation.en_sentence: But if there is economic sense in switching to you guys, then it'll certainly be worth taking a look.
conversation.ja_sentence: しかし、弊社にしたほうが経済的に道理にかなうなら、検討してみる価値はありますよ。

conversation.ja_speaker: ジェイ トレヴィーノさん
conversation.en_sentence: That sounds great.
conversation.ja_sentence: 助かります。

conversation.ja_speaker: ジェイ トレヴィーノさん
conversation.en_sentence: I could see a potential in partnering up as our current service provider has a limited geographic footprint.
conversation.ja_sentence: 今使っている整備会社は地理的な展開が限られているので、パートナー関係の可能性が見えてきましたよ。

conversation.ja_speaker: ジェイ トレヴィーノさん
conversation.en_sentence: It would be great if your proposal can list where your facilities are located.
conversation.ja_sentence: 提案書に施設の所在地リストが含まれているといいのですが。

conversation.ja_speaker: ジェイ トレヴィーノさん
conversation.en_sentence: Great, thank you both for the call today.
conversation.ja_sentence: お二人ともありがとうございました、今日は電話でお話できてよかったです。

conversation.ja_speaker: ジェイ トレヴィーノさん
conversation.en_sentence: Sounds good.
conversation.ja_sentence: お願いします。

conversation.ja_speaker: ジェイ トレヴィーノさん
conversation.en_sentence: Good bye.
conversation.ja_sentence: 失礼します。

conversation.en_sentence: Yeah, no one ever makes a new batch when it's empty.

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Oh, that's not very significant.

conversation.en_sentence: That's a big jump.

conversation.en_sentence: I'm sure a lot of businesses will be affected by that.

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: But, that also means that it's a business opportunity.

conversation.en_sentence: Exactly.

conversation.en_sentence: These events can really affect the way we do business.

conversation.en_sentence: Did you get this from the clearance section?
conversation.ja_sentence: 在庫一掃コーナーにありましたか？

conversation.en_sentence: Alright, let me go and grab my machine so I can check the price for you.
conversation.ja_sentence: なるほど、機械を取ってきて値段を調べさせていただきますね。

conversation.en_sentence: Or is it ok if I just take it with me and come back?
conversation.ja_sentence: それとも、これちょっとお預かりして、戻って来てもいいですか？

conversation.en_sentence: I will be right back.
conversation.ja_sentence: すぐに戻ります。

conversation.en_sentence: Hi there, thanks for waiting.
conversation.ja_sentence: どうも、お待たせいたしました。

conversation.en_sentence: So this is actually from the clearance section.
conversation.ja_sentence: それでですね、これは在庫一掃コーナーのものでした。

conversation.en_sentence: Somehow the price tag fell off I guess.
conversation.ja_sentence: 何故か値札が外れてしまったようですね。

conversation.en_sentence: The original price is thirty four dollars but you can get fifty percent off.
conversation.ja_sentence: 元のお値段は34ドルですが、50％オフです。

conversation.en_sentence: That will be seventeen dollars plus tax.
conversation.ja_sentence: 税抜きで17ドルになりますね。

conversation.en_sentence: Is there anything else you need?
conversation.ja_sentence: 他に何かございますか？

conversation.en_sentence: You're very welcome.
conversation.ja_sentence: どういたしまして。

conversation.en_sentence: Enjoy your shopping.
conversation.ja_sentence: お買い物をお楽しみくださいませ。

conversation.en_sentence: You want me to take on more responsibility?
conversation.ja_sentence: 僕にこれ以上責任を負えというんですか？

conversation.en_sentence: Oh no, you are not thinking...
conversation.ja_sentence: いやいや、そんな考えあなたが...

conversation.en_sentence: So, you mean you want me to fill Mari's position?
conversation.ja_sentence: つまり、私に真理の仕事をしてくれということですか？

conversation.en_sentence: I'm flattered that you use American colloquialism, but don't you think Eugina is more of an appropriate choice?
conversation.ja_sentence: アメリカ的な口語表現を使っていただき恐縮ですが、ユージーナがよりふさわしい選択肢だと思いませんか？

conversation.en_sentence: Just hire someone new for Global Relations and Eugina can manage Sales.
conversation.ja_sentence: グローバル・リレーションズに誰か新しく雇えば、ユージーナで営業を管理できますよ。

conversation.en_sentence: I mean she has an MBA from an Ivy League and at least a decade of management experience.
conversation.ja_sentence: 彼女はアイビーリーグのMBAを持っていて、少なくとも10年のマネジメント経験がありますから。

conversation.en_sentence: Yeah, she told me she has a special needs son.
conversation.ja_sentence: はい、特別援助が必要な息子さんがいるって聞きました。

conversation.en_sentence: You know I'm a college dropout.
conversation.ja_sentence: 僕がカレッジの中退者だとご存じですよね。

conversation.en_sentence: Yeah, I don't even know how I ended up being hired.
conversation.ja_sentence: ええ、どうして僕が雇われることになったかすら分かりません。

conversation.en_sentence: I'm finding out everyone else here is an ivy leaguer.
conversation.ja_sentence: ここでは僕以外全員がアイビーリーグ出身者だと知って。

conversation.en_sentence: Mari, John, Eugina, Taichi, Won Bin, Yumi, all of our scientists, not to mention our management, and Kate!
conversation.ja_sentence: 真理、ジョン、ユージーナ、ウォン・ビン、由美、科学者全員、うちの経営陣は言うまでもないですが、ケイトも！

conversation.en_sentence: Jesus, she was Harvard Summa cum laude!
conversation.ja_sentence: ビックリですよ、彼女はハーバードの最優秀生だったんですよ！

conversation.en_sentence: Can you just not rub it in.
conversation.ja_sentence: もう言わないでもらえます？

conversation.en_sentence: Keiko's going to block it.
conversation.ja_sentence: 社長が反対しますよ。
友井さん、ちょっとよろしいですか？
conversation.en_sentence: Tomoi-san, do you have a moment?

conversation.ja_sentence: 今度、新規でA社様にシステムを導入することになりまして。
conversation.en_sentence: We will be newly implementing Company A's system next time.

conversation.ja_sentence: 当社の既存の契約書でお願いしたいと思い、雛形を提示したんです。
conversation.en_sentence: I thought of asking them to use our existing contract so I showed them our template.

conversation.ja_sentence: そうしたら、先方の顧問弁護士事務所から指摘事項があったみたいで。
conversation.en_sentence: But there were sections pointed out by their legal counsel.

conversation.ja_sentence: いくつか文言の変更を打診されたんですが、どうすればいいですか？
conversation.en_sentence: They asked to change some of the language but what should we do?

conversation.ja_sentence: この資料の通りです。
conversation.en_sentence: It's as this document shows.

conversation.ja_sentence: 先方も、法務部経由で顧問弁護士とやりとりしているみたいです。
conversation.en_sentence: It seems they are also dealing with their legal counsel through the legal department.

conversation.ja_sentence: 契約の締結は直接法務部とやってほしい、と言われています。
conversation.en_sentence: They told us to execute the contract directly with the legal department.

conversation.ja_sentence: 了解しました。
conversation.en_sentence: Okay.

conversation.ja_sentence: ありがとうございます。
conversation.en_sentence: Thank you very much.

conversation.ja_sentence: 新システムの導入、先方の希望は２月１日です。
conversation.en_sentence: Their request is February 1st which is when the new system will be implemented.

conversation.ja_sentence: はい、しかし実質の導入作業は来月から始めないと間に合わないので。
conversation.en_sentence: Yes, but the actual implementation work will have to start from next month otherwise we won't make it in time.

conversation.ja_sentence: 作業開始までには契約関係をクリアしたいのですが。
conversation.en_sentence: I'd like to get the contract related matters out of the way by the time we start the work.

conversation.ja_sentence: はい、席に戻り次第、資料をメールで送ります。
conversation.en_sentence: Okay, I will send you the document by email once I get back to my seat.

conversation.ja_sentence: お世話になっています、M信託銀行の能勢ですが。
conversation.en_sentence: Hope you guys are doing well, this is Nose from Trust Bank M.

conversation.ja_sentence: そうです、おられます？
conversation.en_sentence: Yes please, is he in?

conversation.ja_sentence: M信託銀行の能勢です。
conversation.en_sentence: This is Nose from M Trust Bank.

conversation.ja_sentence: ちょっと今お時間いいですか？
conversation.en_sentence: Is this a good time to talk?

conversation.ja_sentence: 一つ、他部署から御社に話を繋げてほしいと依頼があってね。
conversation.en_sentence: Just one thing, another department of ours wanted me to tell you this.

conversation.ja_sentence: 御社の株主さんに対してアンケートを実施したらどうか、という提案をしたいと。
conversation.en_sentence: They want to give you a proposal of conducting questionnaires with your shareholders.

conversation.ja_sentence: うちの会社にそういうことを専門にやってるチームがありまして。
conversation.en_sentence: Our company has a team specifically assigned to work on an area like this.

conversation.ja_sentence: 株主総会決議通知に葉書で株主アンケートを同封して、御社のIRについて検証したらどうか、ということらしいよ。
conversation.en_sentence: They want to see if you guys are interested in sending the questionnaires along with the notice of shareholders resolution to conduct a survey on your investor relations.

conversation.ja_sentence: それをまとめて、御社に新たなIRの仕方を提案する、といった感じで。
conversation.en_sentence: They can propose a new, better approach for investor relations based on the summary of the answers.

conversation.ja_sentence: 詳しくは、担当部署からご提案させてもらうことになるけど、その為にアポイントをお願いしたいんだけど、どうでしょう？
conversation.en_sentence: The department in charge will give you the detailed proposal later on, but I would like to set up an appointment for that if possible.

conversation.ja_sentence: いつが都合いいですか？
conversation.en_sentence: When will be a good time for you?

conversation.ja_sentence: 了解、調整して今日中に連絡します。
conversation.en_sentence: Ok, I will set it up and get back to you by the end of the day.

conversation.ja_sentence: 直接の担当者２名と私で伺いますよ。
conversation.en_sentence: Both the person in charge and I will be there.

conversation.ja_sentence: はい、また連絡します。
conversation.en_sentence: Yes sir, I will get back to you soon.

conversation.ja_sentence: 何？
conversation.en_sentence: What?

conversation.ja_sentence: 予算はどれくらい？
conversation.en_sentence: What's the budget?

conversation.ja_sentence: 去年の出席者が１００名くらいだったよね？
conversation.en_sentence: There were about 100 attendees last year, weren't there?

conversation.ja_sentence: 去年の手土産って５００円の金券とお菓子だっけ？
conversation.en_sentence: What were last year's gifts again, a 500 yen gift voucher and some confections?

conversation.ja_sentence: 評判はどうだったの？
conversation.en_sentence: And how were they received?

conversation.ja_sentence: 私、今期の業績下方修正で株主さんから結構電話でもきつく当たられるんだよね。
conversation.en_sentence: Well, due to the profit warning this quarter, plenty of shareholders have spoken quite harsh words to me over the phone.

conversation.ja_sentence: 今年の株主総会はちょっと雰囲気悪くなるかもだし、何か気持ち的に和らぐものがいいな。
conversation.en_sentence: Since there could be a bad atmosphere at this year's general meeting of shareholders, I was thinking something to calm emotions would be good.

conversation.ja_sentence: 鳩の形したサブレとかがいいな。
conversation.en_sentence: Something like dove-shaped shortbread might be nice.

conversation.ja_sentence: 鳩は平和の象徴じゃない。
conversation.en_sentence: Well, a dove is a symbol of peace, isn't it.

conversation.ja_sentence: 私、荒れるなと思うミーティングとか決算説明会では、鳩の絵が入ったスカーフつけるようにしているのよ。
conversation.en_sentence: When I have to appear at a meeting I think is going to be rough, or a financial results briefing, I always make the effort to wear a scarf with a pattern of doves on it.

conversation.ja_sentence: 一種の験担ぎみたいなものなんだけど。
conversation.en_sentence: I mean, I guess it's kind of a superstition.

conversation.ja_sentence: 焼き菓子は万人受けするし、なにより賞味期限がながいからね。
conversation.en_sentence: Plus, everybody likes baked goods, and above all, they have long expiration dates.

conversation.ja_sentence: 何でもいいからすがりたい時もあるのよ。
conversation.en_sentence: It doesn't really matter what it is, but sometimes you just want something to cling to.

conversation.ja_sentence: よろしくね。
conversation.en_sentence: Thanks.
